results.title: The Legend of the holy drinker
results.creator_credit: Cecchi Gori Group, Tiger Cinematografica, Aura Film, Roberta Cicutto, Vincenzo de Leo, Mario Cecchi Gori, Vittorio Cecchi Gori and Ermanno Olmi
results.brief_description: In this award winning Italian film based on the novel by Joseph Roth, Rutger Hauer plays Andreas, an ex-miner jailed for an accidental murder. Released from prison, he is living the life of an alcoholic derelict, under the bridges of Paris until he comes into contact with a stranger, who gives him 200 francs. Andreas is confident of finding work and insists that the money should be a loan only. The stranger asks that he repay the debt to the local parish priest, as soon as he is in a position to do so. Despite Andreas’ good intentions, he is continually caught up with events or old acquaintances that part him from his money, yet strangely, the 200 francs keeps reappearing back in his wallet. Cast also includes Anthony Quayle, Sandrine Dumas, Sophie Segalen and Dominique Pinon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cecchi Gori Group, Tiger Cinematografica, Aura Film, Roberta Cicutto, Vincenzo de Leo, Mario Cecchi Gori, Vittorio Cecchi Gori and Ermanno Olmi

results.title: The Left handed gun
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Fred Coe and Arthur Penn
results.brief_description: Adapted from the play by Gore Vidal, “The Left Handed Gun” is the story of William Bonney, the hotheaded gunslinger known as Billy the Kid. Avoiding the usual Hollywood glamourisation of this controversial character, Paul Newman portrays Billy pretty much as he was: an illiterate, homicidal youth. Treated with kindness for the first time in his life by rancher Tunstall, Billy becomes devoted to the rancher. After Tunstall is killed, however, Billy is prompted to go on a murderous spree avenging the death of his former employer. Cast includes: Paul Newman, James Best, Lita Milan, Hurd Hatfield, and James Congdon.

results.title: The Leather boys
results.creator_credit: Viewfinder Film Productions, Raymond Stross and Sidney J. Furie
results.brief_description: The disillusion of a disappointing marriage leads a young mechanic into a relationship with a fellow motor cyclist in this often perceptive study of masculinity, shot on a small budget in a London working class environment. The homosexuality at the heart of the relationship is sympathetically (for the time) brought into the open, negating the myth of the buddy relationship as a neutral escape route from the role playing in male-female relationships. Based on the novel by Eliot George. Cast includes Colin Campbell, Rita Tushingham and Dudley Sutton.

results.title: The League of gentlemen
results.creator_credit: Allied Filmmakers, Michael Relph and Basil Dearden
results.brief_description: A disgruntled army colonel who has been forcibly retired decides to take revenge on England by executing a daring daylight bank robbery. To undertake the crime he commandeers seven ex-army men who have fallen foul of the law in some way or other. The eight men (who don’t know each other) treat the assignment like a reconnaissance mission, carefully planned under the leadership of Colonel Hyde. “The League of gentlemen” is an old-fashioned caper movie that moves exceptionally well through the stages of the crime: the initial research, the preparations, the raid for ammunition, the day of the heist, the aftermath. The film also serves as a timepiece for England in the late 1950s - the last dregs of post-war hang-ups, the loosening of morals and hints of the swinging 60s, the displacement of these men who have moved from the heroism of their war years to shady existences. Adapted from the novel by John Boland, “The League of Gentlemen” has a pacey and witty script that is buoyed by fine performances from Jack Hawkins, Nigel Patrick, Roger Livesey and Richard Attenborough.

results.title: The Leading man
results.creator_credit: J and M Entertainment, Bertil Ohlsson, Paul Raphael and John Duigan
results.brief_description: This romantic comedy, starring Jon Bon Jovi, is set in the London theatre world. When successful playwright Felix Webb (Lambert Wilson) can’t enjoy the success of his latest masterpiece because he has fallen passionately in love with a young actress, he enlists young, charismatic Hollywood actor Robin Grange (Bon Jovi) to seduce his wife into leaving him. However, as Felix weaves his web of mischief, fate intervenes and both Felix and Robin learn that real life doesn’t always follow the script.

results.title: The Lawnmower man
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Allied Vision, Lane Pringle Productions, Fuji Eight, Gimel Everett and Brett Leonard
results.brief_description: A brilliant scientist, obsessed with perfecting a revolutionary virtual reality software program, enlists the aid of a slow-witted gardener, only to encounter a shadowy group seeking to turn the “lawnmower man” into the ultimate weapon. Stars Pierce Brosnan with Jeff Fahey, Jenny Wright, Mark Bringleson, Geoffrey Lewis.

results.title: The Last Wave [DVD] (A)
results.creator_credit: Ayer Productions, Hal McElroy, James McElroy and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: In this atmospheric mystery thriller a young Sydney lawyer, while defending Aborigines against a murder charge, is troubled by dreams and is drawn into an underground world, the intimations of an ancient civilization. Step by step a series of apparently random occurences assume a disturbing pattern. The city becomes a facade for a place of ancient ritual. Cast includes Richard Chamberlain and David Gulpilil and features photography by Russell Boyd. Features a digitally restored soundtrack.

results.title: The Last waltz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Last Waltz Productions, Robbie Robertson and Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: The Band, the American 1970s rock outfit, were together fifteen years. “The Last waltz” is their farewell concert, staged in 1976 and filmed by Martin Scorsese, that featured a plethora of rock stars including Bob Dylan, Joni Mitchell, Neil Diamond, Van Morrison, Emmylou Harris, Ringo Starr, Neil Young, Eric Clapton, Muddy Waters, The Staples, Dr. John, Ronnie Hawkins, Paul Butterfield, Ron Wood and The Band themselves. As well as filming the occasion, Scorsese also interviewed The Band about their lifestyles, the rigours of touring and their reasons for discontinuing. His footage, which includes some frank and very personal moments, acts as a bittersweet look at an era that was just beginning to fade. Still considered, in terms of quality, one of the best rock concerts ever filmed.

results.title: The Last time I saw Paris
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jack Cummings and Richard Brooks
results.brief_description: Charles Wills (Van Johnson) is a GI with literary ambitions who goes to Paris and meets and falls in love with the wealthy Helen Ellswirth (Elizabeth Taylor). Charles’ ambition to write a novel falls to pieces as failure to sell his writing causes him to turn to alcohol. During a drunken argument Johnson accidentally locks Helen out of their Parisian apartment, causing her to catch a fatal dose of pneumonia. When Helen dies, custody of their child is granted to Helen’s sister, who always disapproved of her sister’s abusive partner. Shocked into action, Charles returns home and finally finds success as a writer, and the conviction to try and regain custody of his daughter. Based on the tragic love story by F. Scott Fitzgerald. Cast also includes Donna Reed, Walter Pidgeon and Eva Gabor.

results.title: The Last time I saw Paris
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jack Cummings and Richard Brooks
results.brief_description: Charles Wills (Van Johnson) is a GI with literary ambitions who goes to Paris and meets and falls in love with the wealthy Helen Ellswirth (Elizabeth Taylor). When Helen dies, custody of their child is granted to Helen’s sister, who always disapproved of her sister’s abusive partner. Shocked into action, Charles returns home and finally finds success as a writer, and the conviction to try and regain custody of his daughter. Based on the tragic love story by F. Scott Fitzgerald. Cast also includes Donna Reed, Walter Pidgeon and Eva Gabor. The tape also includes interviews with Liz Taylor and Richard Burton on literary roles as well as Donna Read on location and in rehearsal.
